title: Agile Ceremony Bloat
context: Organizations adopt Agile (usually Scrum) to move faster. Initially it works — small teams, short cycles, rapid feedback. Then the organization scales. More teams mean more coordination. Coordination means more ceremonies. Stand-ups, sprint planning, backlog grooming, retrospectives, PI planning, scrum-of-scrums, demo days. What started as a lightweight process becomes a calendar-consuming bureaucracy that leaves less time for actual building.
hypothesis: Agile ceremonies improve team coordination and delivery speed at scale.

effects.label: Ceremony count multiplies with team count

children.label: Deep work time shrinks to 2-3 hour fragments
Context switching between meetings destroys flow state
Senior engineers spend more time talking about work than doing it

effects.label: Ceremonies become performative rather than productive
effects.impact: 60-70% of attendees report meetings are wasteful

children.label: Stand-ups become status reports to managers, not team sync
Retrospectives produce action items nobody follows up on

effects.label: Process compliance replaces outcome focus
effects.impact: Teams optimize for ceremony metrics, not delivery

children.label: Velocity becomes a vanity metric gamed by point inflation
Scrum masters become process police rather than enablers
Teams that skip ceremonies are labeled 'not Agile' regardless of output
High performers seek environments with more autonomy
Remaining team regresses to mean productivity

dontIf: Your teams are already shipping well with lighter processes
You're adopting SAFe primarily because a consultant recommended it
ifYouMust: Cap total ceremony time at 10% of available work hours
Make every meeting optional for individual contributors — attendance by choice
Kill any ceremony that can't demonstrate concrete value in a 30-day review
Replace synchronous ceremonies with async updates wherever possible

alternatives.name: Shape Up
alternatives.note: Basecamp's methodology — 6-week cycles, no daily stand-ups, small autonomous teams

alternatives.name: Async-first Kanban
alternatives.note: Pull-based work with async status updates, meetings only when blocked

alternatives.name: Team-chosen process
alternatives.note: Let each team pick their own process and measure outcomes, not compliance

sources.title: Atlassian: State of Teams 2024
sources.note: 72% of developers report too many meetings, average 8-15 hours/week in ceremonies

sources.title: Microsoft Research: The Cost of Interrupted Work
sources.note: It takes 23 minutes to recover focus after an interruption — each ceremony fragments deep work

sources.title: Stack Overflow Developer Survey 2024
sources.note: Meeting overload consistently ranked as top productivity killer by developers

sources.title: Basecamp: Shape Up
sources.note: Alternative methodology that explicitly rejects ceremony-heavy Agile

falsifiability: Organizations with more Agile ceremonies per week deliver features faster than those with fewer
Developer satisfaction increases as ceremony count scales with team size
Velocity metrics from ceremony-heavy teams correlate with actual customer value delivered

seo.description: Scaling Agile triples developer meeting time to 12-18 hrs/week, cuts deep work by 60%, and reduces actual delivery speed by 25%. Ceremonies become performative bureaucracy.
keywords: agile ceremony bloat second order effects
